title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'cannot access a Thread Local Storage value during or after destruction: AccessError'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code While bootstraping rustc, stage1 compiler encounters internal error. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` stage1/bin/rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.55.0 binary: rustc commit-hash: unknown commit-date: unknown host: i686-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.55.0 LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'cannot access a Thread Local Storage value during or after destruction: AccessError', /root/rustc-1.55.0-src/library/std/src/thread/local.rs:375:26 error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.55.0 running on i686-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z macro-backtrace -Z crate-attr=doc(html_root_url="https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.55.0/") -Z binary-dep-depinfo -Z force-unstable-if-unmarked -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=0 -C linker=gcc -C link-args=-Wl,-rpath,$ORIGIN/../lib -C target-feature=-crt-static -C prefer-dynamic -C embed-bitcode=yes --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [symbol_name] computing the symbol for `core_arch::simd::::fmt` #1 [exported_symbols] exported_symbols ```
Backtrace

``` 0: 0xf3a2042a - ::fmt::h8e652133cf421f2a 1: 0xf3ad78e0 - core::fmt::write::hb09c7582f7f09c64 2: 0xf3a065bc - std::io::Write::write_fmt::hee96fda83617bba6 3: 0xf3a0735e - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::hc1cc4d1200864235 4: 0xf3a06ea5 - std::panicking::default_hook::h26cf68d21a009eb3 5: 0xf406a0c2 - rustc_driver::DEFAULT_HOOK::{{closure}}::{{closure}}::hece7cbcefc30ef5a 6: 0xf3a07c5d - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hba3093af22d85989 7: 0xf3a21286 - std::panicking::begin_panic_handler::{{closure}}::hd9dde358b654dd18 8: 0xf3a2057e - std::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_end_short_backtrace::h12e05715bc42cc6d 9: 0xf3a0764e - rust_begin_unwind 10: 0xf39f2250 - core::panicking::panic_fmt::h42f20454d58ca339 11: 0xf39f29b2 - core::result::unwrap_failed::h8348c2f043f3247f 12: 0xf64a11bd - >::hash_stable::h73e98249a3f2a653 13: 0xf66335d2 - >::hash_stable::h729aa2a1bff9eef9 14: 0xf66336f2 -
